accommodate.translation[0].definitions[0: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them
He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
accommodate.translation[0].definitions[1: to provide someone with a place to stay, live, or work
The island was used to accommodate child refugees.
accommodate.translation[0].definitions[2: to accept someone’s opinions and try to do what they want, especially when their opinions or needs are different from yours
We’ve made every effort to accommodate your point of view.
accommodate.translation[0].definitions[3: to get used to a new situation or to make yourself do this
Her eyes took a while to accommodate to the darkness.
